```{r data generation, echo = FALSE, results = 'hide'}
## DATA GENERATION
corrM = diag(nrow = 3)
corrM[1, 2] = sample(c(-2, -1, 1, 2), size = 1) / 10
corrM[2, 3] = sample(c(-2, -1, 1, 2), size = 1) / 10

corrM[2, 1] = corrM[1, 2]
corrM[3, 1] = corrM[1, 3]
corrM[3, 2] = corrM[2, 3]

eigs = eigen(corrM)

mean = round(runif(3, 1, 10), 1)

fet = mean + round(runif(3, -2, 2), 1)
pc = eigs$vectors[, 1]

bmatrix = function(x, digits = 3) {
  text = '\\begin{pmatrix}\n'
  
  x = as.matrix(x)
  x = round(x, digits = digits)
  for (i in 1:nrow(x)) {
    line = paste0(x[i, ], sep = '', collapse = ' & ')
    text = paste0(text, line, '\\\\\n')
  }
  
  text = paste0(text, '\\end{pmatrix}')
  return(text)
}



sol_round <- round(t(pc) %*% (fet - mean), 2)


```

Question
========

We have three original variables. The mean vector is $`r bmatrix(mean)`$, all standard deviations are equal to 1.  

The eigenvector of the correlation matrix that corresponds to a principal component is $`r bmatrix(pc)`$.

Use PCA algorithm to transform the feature vector $`r bmatrix(fet)`$ into the given principal component. 


Provide the answer with 2 decimal digits.
